meanings.definition: Shaped like a needle or pin.
meanings.sent1: The aciform leaves of the pine tree were sharp and thin.
meanings.sent2: The tailor used an aciform needle to sew the delicate fabric.
meanings.sent3: The aciform toothpick was so tiny, it was easy to lose.
meanings.sent4: Her aciform gaze pierced through the darkness of the room.
meanings.sent5: The aciform icicles hanging from the roof sparkled in the sunlight.

meanings.sent1: The aciform blade of the knife made precise cuts.
meanings.sent2: The aciform tower reached high into the sky.
meanings.sent3: The aciform pencil tip broke easily when pressed too hard.
meanings.sent4: His aciform fingers delicately plucked the guitar strings.
meanings.sent5: The aciform spire of the castle stood tall against the horizon.
